# Copilot Instructions for geoclue

## Project Overview

GeoClue is a D-Bus geolocation service for Linux/freedesktop.org systems. It
provides location information via a master service that aggregates data from
multiple provider backends (hostip, geonames, gsmloc, gpsd, gypsy, skyhook,
Yahoo!, etc.).

## Build System

This project uses **autotools** (autoconf/automake/libtool). The typical build
workflow is:

```sh
./configure
make
make install
```

## Code Style

- Written in C following freedesktop.org/GNOME conventions
- Uses GLib/GObject for object system and D-Bus integration
- Follow the existing code style in any file you modify

## Important: Never Check In Build Artifacts

**Do not commit build artifacts or review artifacts to the repository.**

Examples of files that must not be committed:
- Compiled object files: `*.o`, `*.lo`, `*.la`, `*.a`, `*.so`, `*.so.*`
- Libtool directories: `.libs/`
- Automake dependency tracking: `.deps/`
- Generated binaries in provider or source directories
- `config.h` (generated by `./configure`)
- `config.status`, `config.log`
- `Makefile` (only `Makefile.am` and `Makefile.in` belong in source control)
- CodeQL databases and results: `.codeql/`, `*.sarif`, `codeql-results/`
- Any other files generated by the build, test, or CI/analysis process
